cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking generally westward toward the south-central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of Corpus Christi, TX

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to San Luis Pass, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central and upper Texas coast and portions of the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Only slight chance (≈3%) of tropical-storm-force gusts; sustained winds expected below gale force at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the lower Mississippi River near Baton Rouge; coastal surge confined to south-central TX coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may bring 3–5 inches of rain to portions of southeast Louisiana, including possible local runoff issues along the Mississippi River system
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the Louisiana coast, localized flash-flood potential in low-lying areas
